summary.long: 2 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This letter is from Paul and Silas and Timothy. It is to the church in the city of Thessalonica that belongs to God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May you have loving-favor and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must give thanks to God for you always, Christian brothers. It is the right thing to do because your faith is growing so much. Your love for each other is stronger all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are proud of you and tell the other churches about you. We tell them how your faith stays so strong even when people make it hard for you and make you suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God wants you to prove yourselves to be worth being in His holy nation by suffering for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does what is right and will allow trouble to come to those who are making it hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will help you and us who are suffering. This will happen when the Lord Jesus comes down from heaven with His powerful angels in a bright fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will punish those who do not know God and those who do not obey the Good News of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be punished forever and taken away from the Lord and from the shining-greatness of His power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day He comes, His shining-greatness will be seen in those who belong to Him. On that day, He will receive honor from all those who put their trust in Him. You believed what we had to say to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, we always pray for you. We pray that our God will make you worth being chosen. We pray that His power will help you do the good things you want to do. We pray that your work of faith will be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way, the name of the Lord Jesus Christ will be honored by you and you will be honored by Him. It is through the loving-favor of our God and of the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our Lord Jesus Christ is coming again. We will be gathered together to meet Him. But we ask you, Christian brothers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do not be troubled in mind or worried by the talk you hear. Some say that the Lord has already come. People may say that I wrote this in a letter or that a spirit told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone fool you. For the Lord will not come again until many people turn away from God. Then the leader of those who break the law will come. He is the man of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He works against and puts himself above every kind of god that is worshiped. He will take his seat in the house of God and say that he himself is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not remember that while I was with you, I told you this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the power that is keeping the man of sin back now. The man of sin will come only when his time is ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the secret power of breaking the law is already at work in the world. But that secret power can only do so much until the One Who keeps back the man of sin is taken out of the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this man of sin will come. The Lord Jesus will kill him with the breath of His mouth. The coming of Christ will put an end to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan will use this man of sin. He will have Satan’s power. He will do strange things and many powerful works that will be false.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are lost in sin will be fooled by the things he can do. They are lost in sin because they did not love the truth that would save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, God will allow them to follow false teaching so they will believe a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will all be guilty as they stand before God because they wanted to do what was wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christian brothers, the Lord loves you. We always thank God for you. It is because God has chosen you from the beginning to save you from the punishment of sin. He chose to make you holy by the Holy Spirit and to give you faith to believe the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was by our preaching the Good News that you were chosen. He chose you to share the shining-greatness of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, Christian brothers, keep a strong hold on what we have taught you by what we have said and by what we have written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our Lord Jesus Christ and God our Father loves us. Through His loving-favor He gives us comfort and hope that lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May He give your hearts comfort and strength to say and do every good thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My last words to you, Christian brothers, are that you pray for us. Pray that the Word of the Lord will go out over all the land and prove its power just as it did with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that we will be kept from sinful men, because not all men are Christians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful. He will give you strength and keep you safe from the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have faith in the Lord for you. We believe you are doing and will keep on doing the things we told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord lead your hearts into the love of God. May He help you as you wait for Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is what we tell you to do, Christian brothers. In the name of the Lord Jesus, keep away from any Christian who is lazy and who does not do what we taught you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know you should follow the way of life we lived when we were with you. We worked hard while we were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We did not eat anyone’s food without paying for it. We worked hard night and day so none of you would have to give us anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We could have asked you to give us food. But we did not so that you might follow our way of living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we were with you, we told you that if a man does not work, he should not eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We hear that some are not working. But they are spending their time trying to see what others are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our words to such people are that they should be quiet and go to work. They should eat their own food. In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ we say this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, Christian brothers, do not get tired of doing good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not want to listen to what we say in this letter, remember who he is and stay away from him. In that way, he will be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not think of him as one who hates you. But talk to him as a Christian brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord of peace give you His peace at all times. The Lord be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this last part with my own hand. It is the way I finish all my letters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May all of you have loving-favor from our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator
